intro: Isachne mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to the island of Mauritius and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, two-lobed flowers. Isachne mauritiana is adapted to grow in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or disturbed habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
